I AGREE, Thanks for an unexpected bonus for NEW YEARS!! TvTEAM always uploads top notch stuff. THANKS. I haven't got it downloaded but will comment when it does. 

JUST for the record:

Can't speak for everyone, but I am anxious to see this. The original movie has JOHN WAYNE, Robert Duvall and many other big time mega stars of hollywood and was to me a CLASSIC and of the caliber of films like:
 THE WIZARD OF OZ. I can't imagine that any director in his right mind would even consider re-doing THE WIZARD of OZ or TO KILL A MOCKINGBIRD, GONE WITH THE WIND, or A STREET CAR NAMED DESIRE, CASA-BLANCA, WHERE EAGLES DARE, THE GUNS OF NAVARONE w/ Gregory Peck, Anthony Quinn, David Niven or  PAPILLION w/ Steve McQueen and Dustin Hoffman, I heard ramblings of a re make of BULLITT, another Steve McQueen Classic.  I could go on and on. I guess I always considered TRUE GRITto be in the same class and era as these other great FILMS. There has been a huge amount of redoing of older movies in the last 10 years or so. I guess its a matter of time.

TRON is being re made and is coming out very very soon. (the orig. came out in 1982 or about that time).

THE HITCHER, originally with RUDGER HOWARD was re made with SEAN BEAN as the bad guy. I heard that BLADE RUNNER is being remade (GOD ONLY KNOWS WHY, it is CLASSIC RIDLEY SCOTT and one of my all time favorite SCI-FI films. Next thing you know, they will re make 2001 a SPACE ODESSY by STANLEY KUBRIK or THE CLOCKWORK ORANGE. 
I am curious to see this TRUE GRIT and what they did with it, but I'd be lying if I said I wasn't a bit nervous of all these re makes of films that do not need any remaking. If it isn't broken, the why "fix" it??? HAPPY NEW YEARS ALL!!!
